shared_diagnostic_path.reasoning_pattern: New symptoms + recent drug → temporal correlation → syndrome recognition

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose the pediatric patient presenting with a low-grade fever, itchy rash, and generalized joint pain following antibiotic treatment.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department because of a 2-day history of low-grade fever, itchy rash, and generalized joint pain. The rash initially started in the antecubital and popliteal fossae before spreading to the trunk and distal extremities. One week ago, she was diagnosed with acute sinusitis and started on amoxicillin. She has no history of adverse drug reactions, and her immunizations are up to date.

Secondary_Symptoms: Rash in the antecubital and popliteal fossae
Rash spread to trunk and distal extremities

Patient_Actor.Past_Medical_History: Diagnosed with acute sinusitis one week ago, no known history of adverse drug reactions, immunizations up to date.

Findings: Multiple erythematous, annular plaques of variable sizes over the entire body
One lesion in the right popliteal fossa has an area of central clearing

Joint_Examination.Findings: Generalized joint pain, no swelling or redness observed

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose the patient presenting with a 2-day history of fever and altered mentation.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 2-day history of fever and altered mentation, reporting fever without chills and rigors. He denies sore throat, abdominal pain, headache, loose stool, burning micturition, or seizures. Has a history of tics and is currently taking haloperidol.

Secondary_Symptoms: Normal deep tendon reflexes with bilateral downgoing plantar responses

Patient_Actor.Past_Medical_History: History of tics, currently on a low dose of haloperidol.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: Patient details on social and occupational history not provided.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: Denies headache, abdominal pain, loose stools, burning micturition, or seizures.

Neurological_Examination.Motor_Exam: Generalized rigidity, able to move all limbs
Neurological_Examination.Reflexes: Normal deep tendon reflexes with bilateral downgoing plantar responses

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient with psychiatric condition and new onset movement disorder.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is here for a follow-up appointment. He was recently diagnosed with schizophrenia and started on risperidone approximately 2 months ago. Reports a significant improvement in psychiatric symptoms since the start of treatment.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Inability to remain still, persistent feeling of restlessness
Secondary_Symptoms: Repetitive crossing and uncrossing of legs

Patient_Actor.Past_Medical_History: Recently diagnosed with schizophrenia. No other significant past medical history.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: College student, lives with parents. Denies tobacco, alcohol, or drug use.

Review_of_Systems.Psychiatric: Improvement in delusions, hallucinations, and paranoid behaviors since starting risperidone.
Review_of_Systems.Neurological: No history of seizures, headaches, or previous movement disorders.

Neurological_Examination.Mental_Status: Alert and oriented to person, place, time, and situation. Improved psychotic symptoms.
Neurological_Examination.Motor: Normal tone and strength in all extremities. No involuntary movements noted.
Neurological_Examination.Gait: Normal, but patient exhibits inability to sit still with frequent pacing

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage the patient presenting with altered mental status, autonomic dysregulation, and muscle rigidity.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department by police after he was found undressing himself outside in extremely hot weather. The patient is uncooperative, refusing to answer questions due to paranoia about being spied on. He has a history of polysubstance abuse and a recent visit to the ED for intoxication.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: Recently started college. Known history of substance use.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: Unable to obtain due to patient's non-compliance and altered mental status.

Neurological_Examination.Autonomic_Signs: Dry mucous membranes indicating possible dehydration

CBC.White_Blood_Cell_Count: Normal range but specifics not provided
CBC.Hemoglobin: Normal range but specifics not provided
CBC.Platelets: Normal range but specifics not provided

Renal_Function_Tests.Creatinine: Within normal limits but specifics not provided
Renal_Function_Tests.BUN: Within normal limits but specifics not provided

Blood_Gas_Analysis.Findings: Mild metabolic acidosis (specific values not provided)

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose the patient presenting with a concerning rash and recent health changes.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a rash that started last night, finding it very concerning. He does not recall being exposed to any new environmental stimuli such as detergents or plants like poison ivy. He mentions he recently started seeing a primary care provider for arthritis management and a new onset cough.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Rash on the upper half of the back
Secondary_Symptoms: Unaware of exposure to new environmental stimuli

Patient_Actor.Past_Medical_History: Has been diagnosed with arthritis. No other significant past medical history has been mentioned.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: The patient didn't provide any specific social history details during the initial consultation.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: Reports a new onset cough along with skin and mucosal changes but denies fever, shortness of breath, joint pains, gastrointestinal symptoms, or recent illnesses.

Skin_Examination.General: Coalescing erythematous macules, bullae, desquamation noted.
Skin_Examination.Distribution: Localized to the upper half of the back.
Skin_Examination.Mucous_Membranes: Ulcers and erythema present in oropharynx.

Cardiopulmonary_Exam.Cardiac: Normal rate and rhythm, no murmurs or gallops.
Cardiopulmonary_Exam.Pulmonary: Clear to auscultation bilaterally, no wheezes, rales, or rhonchi.

Physical_Examination_Findings.Abdominal_Exam: Soft, non-tender, no hepatosplenomegaly, normoactive bowel sounds throughout.

Skin_Biopsy.Findings: Epidermal necrosis and detachment, consistent with severe drug reaction.

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage a young adult patient presenting with altered mental status, suspected of having a serious drug reaction.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department by the police after he was found undressing himself outdoors in extremely hot weather. He is uncooperative, refuses to answer questions, and exhibits paranoid behavior. He has a recent history of presenting to the emergency department for polysubstance intoxication.
Patient_Actor.Past_Medical_History: History of substance use. No other significant medical history reported.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: Recently started college. History of polysubstance abuse.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: Unable to complete due to patient's non-responsiveness and lack of cooperation.

Neurological_Examination.Coordination_and_Motor_Function: Unable to assess due to non-compliance
Neurological_Examination.Muscle_Rigidity: Rigidity noted upon attempt to manipulate extremities

Urine_Drug_Screen.Findings: Pending or could show presence of recent substance use
